sections.section: IBM Integration Bus provides a facility to send logging information from configured integration servers to IBM Bluemix where you can display the reported information in a Kibana dashboard. This logging service is currently provided free of charge but is not yet recommended for use with a production environment (because IBM has not yet provided guarantees regarding large volumes of data and log retention periods).

This tutorial demonstrates how IBM Integration Bus provides a sample (version 4) Kibana dashboard. Graphical and tabular views enable you to see important information quickly and easily. Users can change or replace these views with charts and tables of their own.

sections.section: Configure IBM Integration Bus to send Logs to Kibana in Bluemix

details.details: Configure your integration server to send its log events to Bluemix:
Open the IBM Integration Console window and type the following commands:
mqsistop TESTNODE_userid where TESTNODE_userid is the IIB node name

mqsichangebluemixreporting TESTNODE_userid -g -l active -r us-south -o a.user@comp.com -a dev -u joe.bloggs@company.com -p password123 -d
where
us-south is your Bluemix region (either us-south or eu-gb)
dev is your Bluemix organization
joe.bloggs@company.com is your Bluemix userid
password123 is your Bluemix password
mqsistart TESTNODE_userid where TESTNODE_userid is the IIB node name

sections.section: Import the provided test application into your workspace

details.details: When you click the Import option (to the right), the LogMessages Application will be created in your workspace.

The LogMessages application also contains a message flow named LogMessages which has a Compute node which logs different types of messages into the system log and also a Trace node for recording the logical tree structure in the log at the end of the flow. The execution of this message flow will be used as a way to create data for us to view in the Kibana dashboard.

sections.section: Follow the instructions below to configuration an integration server to the IBM Integration Bus Kibana dashboard.

details.details: Follow the instructions in Configuring the integration server and loading the IBM Integration Bus Kibana dashboard manually of the Knowledge Center to setup and import all thes into Kibana 4.
Once everything are imported, select the Dashboard tab under Kibana 4 and click on Load Saved Dasboard (open folder) button.
Under the Dashboard Filter entry field, select IBM Integration Bus Dashboard, this will open the imported dashboard with the predefined visuals.
If the visuals are displaying the message No results found, try changing the time filter (clock icon on top right) to a larger value.

sections.section: Deploy the LogMessages application to your integration server and run it a few times to generate some data for the log.
Use the instruction below to create a custom chart to track a specific IBM Integration Bus log messages:

details.details: In Kibana 4 click on Visualize and then Vertical bar chart.
Select From a saved search, and then IBM Log Events.
Click on X-Axis as the bucket type.
Under Aggregation, select Date Histogram.
Click on Add sub-bucketsSplit Bars.
In the Sub Aggregation field select Filters.
Enter ibm_messageId:3051 into Filter 1 and press the Apply changes (white triangle in a green background) button to update the chart to show data for message id 3051.
Click on the Save Visualize (small disk icon on top right) to save the chart.
Once the chart is saved, it can be add to the dashboard by clicking on the Add Visualization button.
Select the new chart from the list and it will be added to the bottom of the dashboard. You can move and resize it, or replace an existing one in the dashboard.
